result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David D. Powell

records.addlTxt: Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Not operate m/v w/o valid DL
for Discovery and Demand for Production of Documents
for Leave to File Additional Motions

2:38 PM Defendant David D. Powell appeared by video, in custody from LEC with atty. Katie Hayes.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court finds probable cause on four corners of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE  bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. Not operate m/v w/o valid DL.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return date scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
